Frederick Marryat (1792-1848; Dictionary of National Biography); married Thomas Ross Church, June 54; prolific novelist, playwright, actress and singer: see Pilgrim Letters 7, p. 67 and later vols. 17 MAY 1870

body.p: I have been much inconvenienced and pained this last week by a neuralgic attack in the foot to which I am sometimes liable, and which originally came of over walking in deep snow.In Feb 65; see Pilgrim Letters 11, pp. 18-19, and also, To Mrs Ross Church, 6 Aug 67, for a similar attack. The moment I can stand after such a seizure (which in the present case is this moment of writing), I have recourse to change of air. But I shall be back here on Sunday, and happy to receive a call from you on that day between 2 and 3, if that should suit your convenience.
